result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick James Burton

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Defendant Patrick James Burton in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Patrick James Burton.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court is livestreaming for victim. State notes a joint request for another status conference. Attorney Reid in agreement. Court sets status conference
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

8:33 AM Defendant Patrick James Burton in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Patrick James Burton.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty to 1-5, requests status.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:23 AM Defendant Patrick James Burton in court.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Patrick James Burton.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF150, Attorney Reid notes defendant is not ready to proceed with arraignment and asks for 30 days. Asks for another status in 22CM128 and 21CM306. State has no objection. Court sets adjourned arraignment and statuses.
Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Calling cases 22CF150 for prelim and 22CM128 for STC
10:43 AM Defendant Patrick James Burton in court with Attorney Ellen Craker.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court sets STC on 22CM128. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick James Burton appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ellen Denise Craker appeared by video for Patrick James Burton. Attorney Craker received complaints enter not guilty on 22CM128 and preliminary hearing on 22CF150. Court quashes warrant in 22CF150. Attorney Craker does not have information on non appearance. State requests $500 cash bail with no specific conditions in 22CF150 and in 22CM128, $500 cash bail with condition of no contact with Skyler Hiese. State notes same victim in cases. Attorney Craker requesting signature bond states defendant has made all appearances in open file and had a signature bond in that file. Attorney Craker notes local ties. Court orders in 22CF150, $3,000 signature bond with condition of compliance of court orders. In 22CM128, $1,000 signature bond with condition of no contact with Skyler Hiese.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:58 PM Defendant Patrick James Burton not in court.  Attorney Chad La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State sent summons to last known address to Dfd - fail to pay child support, summons returned undeliverable, request warrant WI and MN.
Court orders warrant.
